WorkItem.Description: I have 71 Defense and 52 Resilience (reported by both Rawr and the blizard UI).
WorkItem.Summary: [Bear] Crittable Calculation not Consistent with Blizzard UI

Comments.Message:
Apparently hitting enter submits. Continuing:

I have 71 Defense Rating and 52 Resilience (reported by both Rawr and the blizard UI).

The Blizzard UI reports 71 Defense Rating yeilds 1.20% reduction in crit chance, and 52 Resiliance gives 1.32%. Summing to 2.52% > 2.50% (even with rounding it would only be 2.51%). 

Rawr reports that I'm critable by 0.08097565% and short 8 def or 4 resil.

Attaching Gear in XML

With Survival of the Fittest talent, the cap is 2.60% crit reduction versus level 73 mobs (bosses).  As you said, 1.20 + 1.32 = 2.52.  You need 2.60 = 2.52 + ~0.08 which Rawr correctly reported.  What's the problem?
Sooo... where's the problem? You need 2.6% to be uncrittable. You've got 2.52%. You need 0.08% more... What am I missing?
When will rawr be updated to take into account the new survival of the fittest talents being 2%/4%/6% reduced crit chance? ie, bears no longer require defense rating to be uncrittable.
